DOC.HEAD: Bush Names 4 Officials to King Holiday Commission
DOC.TEXT: President Bush has decided to name four top government officials to be members of the Martin Luther King Jr., federal holiday commission in 1990. They are Secretaries Jack Kemp of HUD and Lauro Cavazos of Education, and William J. Bennett, director of National Drug Control Policy and Constance B. Newman, director of the Office of Personnel Management. Bush also intends to nominate former Air Force Secretary Edward C. Aldridge Jr., to the president's national security telecommunications advisory committee, and Paul F. Oreffice to the advisory committee for trade policy and negotiations. Oreffice, president and chief excutive officer of the Dow Chemical Company in Midland, Mich., is being reappointed to a two-year term.
